statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 2 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ 6 \\ -9 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 16 \\ 4 \\ -26 \\ 32 \\ -34 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 28 \\ 6 \\ -43 \\ 54 \\ -57 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 2 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ 6 \\ -9 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 16 \\ 4 \\ -26 \\ 32 \\ -34 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 28 \\ 6 \\ -43 \\ 54 \\ -57 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
